subject: Art
title: Triangular Composition
description: Arranging elements in a triangle for stability and classical balance.

hook.text: Renaissance masters loved triangles. The Madonna in the center (apex), flanked by two figures (base). Triangular composition creates stability, grandeur, and classical balance.

buildup.text: Place your main subject at the apex of a triangle, with supporting elements at the two base points. The wide base creates stability. The upward point creates aspiration. The shape is inherently balanced.

discovery.text: Inverted triangles (apex at bottom) create instability and tension â€” useful for dramatic, unsettling compositions. The same geometric shape, flipped, conveys the opposite emotion.

twist.text: Triangular composition works unconsciously. Viewers don't see a triangle â€” they feel stability. The geometry organizes elements without being visible. It's structure that hides behind content.

climax.text: Study Leonardo's Last Supper: Christ is the apex of a triangle. The disciples fan out to either side, forming the base. The composition is rock-solid stable, placing Christ at the undeniable center.

punchline.text: Triangles are the most stable shape. Build your composition on one and it will stand firm.

quiz.question: What feeling does an inverted triangular composition (apex at the bottom) create?
